name: NIST Cybersecurity Framework 2.0
description: Framework for improving critical infrastructure cybersecurity

requirements.title: Organizational Context
requirements.description: The organizational mission is understood and informs cybersecurity risk management
requirements.description_long: The organization's mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood and prioritized; this information is used to inform cybersecurity risk management decisions.

requirements.title: Internal Stakeholders
requirements.description: Internal stakeholders understand and contribute to cybersecurity risk management
requirements.description_long: Internal stakeholders (e.g., executives, legal, IT, HR, risk management) understand their roles and responsibilities in cybersecurity risk management.

requirements.title: Legal and Regulatory Requirements
requirements.description: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements are understood and managed
requirements.description_long: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements regarding cybersecurity, including privacy and civil liberties obligations, are understood and managed.

requirements.title: Critical Objectives
requirements.description: Critical objectives, capabilities, and services are established and communicated
requirements.description_long: Critical objectives, capabilities, and services that stakeholders depend on or expect from the organization are established and communicated.

requirements.title: Outcomes and Dependencies
requirements.description: Outcomes, capabilities, and services that the organization depends on are established and communicated
requirements.description_long: Outcomes, capabilities, and services that the organization depends on are established and communicated, including those provided by suppliers and partners.

requirements.title: Risk Management Objectives
requirements.description: Risk management objectives are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
requirements.description_long: Risk management objectives are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders, including risk tolerance and appetite.

requirements.title: Risk Appetite and Tolerance
requirements.description: Risk appetite and risk tolerance statements are established, communicated, and maintained
requirements.description_long: Risk appetite and risk tolerance statements are established, communicated, and maintained to guide organizational risk decisions.

requirements.title: Risk Management Activities
requirements.description: Cybersecurity risk management activities and outcomes are included in enterprise risk management processes
requirements.description_long: Cybersecurity risk management activities and outcomes are included in enterprise risk management processes and inform strategic decisions.

requirements.title: Strategic Direction
requirements.description: Strategic direction that describes appropriate risk response options is established and communicated
requirements.description_long: Strategic direction that describes appropriate risk response options (accept, avoid, mitigate, transfer) is established and communicated.

requirements.title: Organizational Leadership
requirements.description: Organizational leadership is responsible and accountable for cybersecurity risk
requirements.description_long: Organizational leadership is responsible and accountable for cybersecurity risk and fosters a culture that is risk-aware, ethical, and continually improving.

requirements.title: Roles and Responsibilities
requirements.description: Roles, responsibilities, and authorities related to cybersecurity risk management are established
requirements.description_long: Roles, responsibilities, and authorities related to cybersecurity risk management are established, communicated, understood, and enforced.

requirements.title: Adequate Resources
requirements.description: Adequate resources are allocated commensurate with the cybersecurity risk strategy
requirements.description_long: Adequate resources are allocated commensurate with the cybersecurity risk strategy, roles, responsibilities, and policies.

requirements.title: Cybersecurity in HR Practices
requirements.description: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices
requirements.description_long: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices (e.g., deprovisioning, personnel screening).

requirements.title: Cybersecurity Policy
requirements.description: A policy for managing cybersecurity risks is established based on organizational context
requirements.description_long: A policy for managing cybersecurity risks is established based on organizational context, cybersecurity strategy, and priorities and is communicated and enforced.

requirements.title: Policy Review
requirements.description: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is reviewed, updated, communicated, and enforced
requirements.description_long: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is reviewed, updated, communicated, and enforced to reflect changes in requirements, threats, technology, and organizational mission.

requirements.title: Supply Chain Risk Management Program
requirements.description: A cybersecurity supply chain risk management program is established
requirements.description_long: A cybersecurity supply chain risk management program, strategy, objectives, policies, and processes are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.

requirements.title: Supplier Identification
requirements.description: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for suppliers are established
requirements.description_long: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for suppliers, customers, and partners are established, communicated, and coordinated internally and externally.

requirements.title: Hardware Inventory
requirements.description: Inventories of hardware managed by the organization are maintained
requirements.description_long: Inventories of hardware managed by the organization are maintained, including devices, systems, and components.

requirements.title: Software Inventory
requirements.description: Inventories of software, services, and systems managed by the organization are maintained
requirements.description_long: Inventories of software, services, and systems managed by the organization are maintained, including applications, platforms, and firmware.

requirements.title: Network Communication Flows
requirements.description: Representations of the organization's authorized network communication and data flows are maintained
requirements.description_long: Representations of the organization's authorized network communication and internal and external data flows are maintained.

requirements.title: External Information Systems
requirements.description: Inventories of services provided by suppliers are maintained
requirements.description_long: Inventories of services provided by suppliers are maintained, including cloud services, managed services, and third-party applications.

requirements.title: Asset Prioritization
requirements.description: Assets are prioritized based on classification, criticality, resources, and impact on the mission
requirements.description_long: Assets are prioritized based on classification, criticality, resources, and impact on the mission to inform protection and recovery activities.

requirements.title: Asset Vulnerabilities
requirements.description: Vulnerabilities in assets are identified, validated, and recorded
requirements.description_long: Vulnerabilities in assets are identified, validated, and recorded through vulnerability scanning, penetration testing, and other assessment activities.

requirements.title: Threat Intelligence
requirements.description: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources
requirements.description_long: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources, analyzed, and used to inform risk decisions.

requirements.title: Threat Identification
requirements.description: Internal and external threats to the organization are identified and recorded
requirements.description_long: Internal and external threats to the organization are identified and recorded, including threat actors, tactics, techniques, and procedures.

requirements.title: Impact Analysis
requirements.description: Potential impacts and likelihoods of threats exploiting vulnerabilities are identified and recorded
requirements.description_long: Potential impacts and likelihoods of threats exploiting vulnerabilities are identified and recorded to inform risk assessment and prioritization.

requirements.title: Risk Determination
requirements.description: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to understand inherent risk
requirements.description_long: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to understand inherent risk and inform the prioritization of risk response activities.

requirements.title: Risk Response
requirements.description: Risk responses are chosen, prioritized, planned, tracked, and communicated
requirements.description_long: Risk responses are chosen, prioritized, planned, tracked, and communicated to address identified risks.

requirements.title: Improvement Identification
requirements.description: Improvements are identified from evaluations
requirements.description_long: Improvements are identified from evaluations, including security assessments, exercises, and incident reviews.

requirements.title: Improvement Prioritization
requirements.description: Improvements are prioritized and plans are developed
requirements.description_long: Improvements are prioritized and plans are developed, implemented, and tracked to address identified gaps.

requirements.title: Identity Management
requirements.description: Identities and credentials for authorized users, services, and hardware are managed
requirements.description_long: Identities and credentials for authorized users, services, and hardware are managed by the organization throughout their lifecycle.

requirements.title: Identity Proofing
requirements.description: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials based on the context of interactions
requirements.description_long: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials based on the context of interactions, including the sensitivity of the data and systems accessed.

requirements.title: Authentication
requirements.description: Users, services, and hardware are authenticated
requirements.description_long: Users, services, and hardware are authenticated using appropriate authentication mechanisms based on the sensitivity of the data and systems accessed.

requirements.title: Identity Assertions
requirements.description: Identity assertions are protected, conveyed, and verified
requirements.description_long: Identity assertions are protected, conveyed, and verified to ensure the integrity and authenticity of identity information.

requirements.title: Access Permissions
requirements.description: Access permissions, entitlements, and authorizations are defined and managed
requirements.description_long: Access permissions, entitlements, and authorizations are defined in a policy, managed, enforced, and reviewed, and incorporate the principles of least privilege and separation of duties.

requirements.title: Physical Access
requirements.description: Physical access to assets is managed, monitored, and enforced commensurate with risk
requirements.description_long: Physical access to assets is managed, monitored, and enforced commensurate with risk to protect against unauthorized physical access.

requirements.title: Awareness Training
requirements.description: Personnel are provided awareness and training so they possess the knowledge and skills
requirements.description_long: Personnel are provided awareness and training so they possess the knowledge and skills to perform general tasks with cybersecurity risks in mind.

requirements.title: Privileged User Training
requirements.description: Individuals in specialized roles are provided awareness and training
requirements.description_long: Individuals in specialized roles are provided awareness and training so they possess the knowledge and skills to perform relevant tasks with cybersecurity risks in mind.

requirements.title: Data-at-Rest Protection
requirements.description: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-at-rest are protected
requirements.description_long: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-at-rest are protected through encryption, access controls, and other protective measures.

requirements.title: Data-in-Transit Protection
requirements.description: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-transit are protected
requirements.description_long: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-transit are protected through encryption, secure protocols, and other protective measures.

requirements.title: Data-in-Use Protection
requirements.description: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-use are protected
requirements.description_long: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-use are protected through memory protection, secure enclaves, and other protective measures.

requirements.title: Data Backup
requirements.description: Backups of data are created, protected, maintained, and tested
requirements.description_long: Backups of data are created, protected, maintained, and tested to ensure data can be recovered in the event of data loss or corruption.

requirements.title: Configuration Management
requirements.description: Configuration management practices are established and applied
requirements.description_long: Configuration management practices are established and applied to maintain the security of systems and applications throughout their lifecycle.

requirements.title: Software Maintenance
requirements.description: Software is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk
requirements.description_long: Software is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk, including patching, updating, and decommissioning.

requirements.title: Hardware Maintenance
requirements.description: Hardware is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk
requirements.description_long: Hardware is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk, including maintenance, upgrades, and secure disposal.

requirements.title: Log Records
requirements.description: Log records are generated and made available for continuous monitoring
requirements.description_long: Log records are generated and made available for continuous monitoring, incident response, and forensic analysis.

requirements.title: Installation and Execution
requirements.description: Installation and execution of unauthorized software are prevented
requirements.description_long: Installation and execution of unauthorized software are prevented through application whitelisting, software restriction policies, and other controls.

requirements.title: Secure Software Development
requirements.description: Secure software development practices are integrated and their performance is monitored
requirements.description_long: Secure software development practices are integrated throughout the software development lifecycle and their performance is monitored.

requirements.title: Network Protection
requirements.description: Networks and environments are protected from unauthorized logical access and usage
requirements.description_long: Networks and environments are protected from unauthorized logical access and usage through firewalls, network segmentation, and other controls.

requirements.title: Technology Asset Protection
requirements.description: The organization's technology assets are protected from environmental threats
requirements.description_long: The organization's technology assets are protected from environmental threats, including fire, flood, and other natural disasters.

requirements.title: Resilience Mechanisms
requirements.description: Mechanisms are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations
requirements.description_long: Mechanisms are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations, including redundancy, failover, and recovery capabilities.

requirements.title: Resource Availability
requirements.description: Adequate resource capacity to ensure availability is maintained
requirements.description_long: Adequate resource capacity to ensure availability is maintained through capacity planning, monitoring, and scaling.

requirements.title: Network Monitoring
requirements.description: Networks and network services are monitored to find potentially adverse events
requirements.description_long: Networks and network services are monitored to find potentially adverse events, including intrusion detection, traffic analysis, and anomaly detection.

requirements.title: Physical Environment Monitoring
requirements.description: The physical environment is monitored to find potentially adverse events
requirements.description_long: The physical environment is monitored to find potentially adverse events, including surveillance, access monitoring, and environmental sensors.

requirements.title: Personnel Activity Monitoring
requirements.description: Personnel activity and technology usage are monitored to find potentially adverse events
requirements.description_long: Personnel activity and technology usage are monitored to find potentially adverse events, including user behavior analytics and access monitoring.

requirements.title: External Service Provider Monitoring
requirements.description: External service provider activities and services are monitored to find potentially adverse events
requirements.description_long: External service provider activities and services are monitored to find potentially adverse events, including third-party risk monitoring.

requirements.title: Computing Hardware and Software Monitoring
requirements.description: Computing hardware and software, runtime environments, and their data are monitored
requirements.description_long: Computing hardware and software, runtime environments, and their data are monitored to find potentially adverse events.

requirements.title: Event Analysis
requirements.description: Potentially adverse events are analyzed to better understand associated activities
requirements.description_long: Potentially adverse events are analyzed to better understand associated activities, including correlation, enrichment, and contextualization.

requirements.title: Event Correlation
requirements.description: Information is correlated from multiple sources
requirements.description_long: Information is correlated from multiple sources to achieve situational awareness and support incident detection and response.

requirements.title: Impact Estimation
requirements.description: The estimated impact and scope of adverse events are understood
requirements.description_long: The estimated impact and scope of adverse events are understood to support incident prioritization and response decisions.

requirements.title: Incident Declaration
requirements.description: Information on adverse events is provided to authorized staff and tools
requirements.description_long: Information on adverse events is provided to authorized staff and tools to support incident declaration and response.

requirements.title: Threat Hunting
requirements.description: Cyber threat intelligence and other contextual information are integrated into the analysis
requirements.description_long: Cyber threat intelligence and other contextual information are integrated into the analysis to support proactive threat hunting.

requirements.title: Incident Management Plan
requirements.description: The incident response plan is executed in coordination with relevant third parties
requirements.description_long: The incident response plan is executed in coordination with relevant third parties once an incident is declared.

requirements.title: Incident Triage
requirements.description: Incident reports are triaged and validated
requirements.description_long: Incident reports are triaged and validated to determine the appropriate response and prioritization.

requirements.title: Incident Categorization
requirements.description: Incidents are categorized and prioritized
requirements.description_long: Incidents are categorized and prioritized based on severity, impact, and other factors to guide response activities.

requirements.title: Incident Escalation
requirements.description: Incidents are escalated or elevated as needed
requirements.description_long: Incidents are escalated or elevated as needed based on severity, impact, and organizational policies.

requirements.title: Incident Criteria
requirements.description: The criteria for initiating incident recovery are applied
requirements.description_long: The criteria for initiating incident recovery are applied to determine when to transition from response to recovery activities.

requirements.title: Incident Analysis
requirements.description: Analysis is performed to establish what has taken place during an incident
requirements.description_long: Analysis is performed to establish what has taken place during an incident and the root cause of the incident.

requirements.title: Forensic Investigation
requirements.description: Actions performed during an investigation are recorded
requirements.description_long: Actions performed during an investigation are recorded, and the integrity of the records and collected artifacts is preserved.

requirements.title: Incident Data Collection
requirements.description: Incident data and metadata are collected and their integrity and provenance are preserved
requirements.description_long: Incident data and metadata are collected and their integrity and provenance are preserved for analysis and potential legal proceedings.

requirements.title: Root Cause Analysis
requirements.description: An incident's magnitude is estimated and validated
requirements.description_long: An incident's magnitude is estimated and validated through root cause analysis and impact assessment.

requirements.title: Internal Stakeholder Reporting
requirements.description: Internal and external stakeholders are notified of incidents
requirements.description_long: Internal and external stakeholders are notified of incidents in accordance with organizational policies and legal requirements.

requirements.title: Information Sharing
requirements.description: Information is shared with designated internal and external stakeholders
requirements.description_long: Information is shared with designated internal and external stakeholders to support coordinated response and recovery.

requirements.title: Incident Containment
requirements.description: Incidents are contained
requirements.description_long: Incidents are contained to prevent further damage and limit the scope of the incident.

requirements.title: Incident Eradication
requirements.description: Incidents are eradicated
requirements.description_long: Incidents are eradicated by removing the threat and restoring systems to a known good state.

requirements.title: Recovery Plan Execution
requirements.description: The recovery portion of the incident response plan is executed
requirements.description_long: The recovery portion of the incident response plan is executed once initiated from the incident response process.

requirements.title: Recovery Selection
requirements.description: Recovery actions are selected, scoped, prioritized, and performed
requirements.description_long: Recovery actions are selected, scoped, prioritized, and performed based on the incident impact and organizational priorities.

requirements.title: Backup Verification
requirements.description: The integrity of backups and other restoration assets is verified before using them for restoration
requirements.description_long: The integrity of backups and other restoration assets is verified before using them for restoration to ensure successful recovery.

requirements.title: Critical Function Restoration
requirements.description: Critical mission functions and cybersecurity risk management are considered to establish post-incident operational norms
requirements.description_long: Critical mission functions and cybersecurity risk management are considered to establish post-incident operational norms.

requirements.title: Recovery Verification
requirements.description: The integrity of restored assets is verified, systems and services are restored, and normal operations are confirmed
requirements.description_long: The integrity of restored assets is verified, systems and services are restored, and normal operations are confirmed.

requirements.title: Recovery Completion
requirements.description: The end of incident recovery is declared based on criteria and any necessary follow-up actions are identified
requirements.description_long: The end of incident recovery is declared based on criteria and any necessary follow-up actions are identified.

requirements.title: Recovery Communication
requirements.description: Recovery activities and progress in restoring operational capabilities are communicated
requirements.description_long: Recovery activities and progress in restoring operational capabilities are communicated to designated internal and external stakeholders.

requirements.title: Public Communication
requirements.description: Public updates on incident recovery are shared using approved methods and messaging
requirements.description_long: Public updates on incident recovery are shared using approved methods and messaging to maintain stakeholder confidence.
